title: The cost price of two watches taken together is $840. If by selling one at a profit of 16% and the other at a loss of 12%, there is no loss or gain in the whole transaction. What're the cost price of two watches? - Quora
tags: Staff Selection Commission Combined Graduate Level Exam

response.answer_text: According to the given problem,(i) The cost price of two watches taken together is $840.(ii) If by selling one at a profit of 16% and the other at a loss of 12%, there is no loss or gain in the whole transaction.(iii) Let C1 & C2 denote the cost price of two watches.From (i) & (iii) we get following relation,C1 + C2 = 840 ….. (1a)From (ii) & (iii) we get following relation,(1 + 16/100)*C1 + (1 - 12/100)*C2 = C1 + C2or 1.16*C1 + 0.88*C2 = C1 + C2or 0.16*C1 = 0.12*C2or 4*C1 = 3*C2 ….. (1b)From (1a) & (1b) we get,C1 + (4/3)*C1 = 840or 7*C1 = 3*840 or C1 = 360 ($) [Ans]Hence from (1a) we get,C2 = 840 - C1 = 840 - 360 = 480 ($) [Ans]

Let first watch cost X $ . Second will be 840 - X $ So 116 / 100 X + 88/100 ( 840 - X ) = 840 Or 116 X + 88 ( 840 - X ) = 840 x 100 Or 29 X + 18480 - 22 X = 21000 Or 7 X = 2520 Or X = 360. So 840 - X = 480 The cost of watches are 360 $ and 480 $
